alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 1:47PM EDT until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 345 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Areas of Gulf Breeze and Pensacola beach where drainage is poor will likely see minor flooding over the next hour as a slow moving thunderstorm moves across the area. This area saw 4 to 6 inches of rain last night and is already saturated and if the storm lingers then a warning may be necessary. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1243 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gulf Breeze, Oriole Beach, Pensacola Beach and Villa Sabine.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
